channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No road markings, 12th May
item.description:
Goldsmith Road crossroads What3Words: Pushover.wiser.pills No road markings- Road will be taken on by council this summer. Please advise what markings it’s going to be I.e- main road right of way with give way on joining roads or mini roundabout? Currently it’s the Wild West where no drivers really know who has right of way and it’s a safety issue with near misses every day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Overgrown tree and hedge, 12th May
item.description:
The tree between the corner house and flats is so overgrown that you cannot physically stand up to walk round the corner on the path. You have to either duck down or walk in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Ashlands Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover ‘pot hole’, 12th May
item.description:
On Gretton Road at the Kidderminster Road junction. Sunken drain cover becoming very noisy with any vehicle heavier than a car. Causing house walls and furniture to shake

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highway erosion & potholes, 12th May
item.description:
Erosion and potholes on the highway immediately in front of 12 Highland Road have caused the dropped kerb to no longer be dropped. The dropped kerb is currently approx 60mm above the road surface and getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Highland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees over grown passing over boundaries. Sap on cars, 12th May
item.description:
Numbers 26/28 and 30 Brookfield Road. The sap off the trees are falling onto cars cars which are even patked on property is causing sticky substance debris from trees sticking on the cars due to the sap. Overgrown trees are coming over boundaries onto properties. Causing less light .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge has been removed and heavily planted,, 12th May
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
